page.title: 01Geographical Location
page.content: On the borders of Warwickshire, Leicestershire and Northamptonshire, to the east of Rugby,lie the villages of Clifton,Newton and Catthorpe. Set in mainly agricultural land all three villages are,however,well placed for all forms of transport,the area being crossed by motorways,roads and a main railway link at Rugby.The North Oxford Canal operates in this area and the River Avon is but a "stones throw away." Clifton is the largest of the three villages and is the only one with a school,which caters for children up to the age of eight. Each village still represents the essence of village life,with annual events to bring the community together,whilst still preserving the peace and tranquillity of rural life.
